title: RossBob: A Painting Robot
info: A hackathon submission which won some amazing prizes at the e/acc London Hackathon

title: MEng Thesis: Improving Astronaut Dexterity
info: A solo project. A hydraulic exoskeleton transferring movement from the hand of the user to the robotic appendage, and tactile feeling from the robot to the finger tips of the user - resulting in better tactile identification when compared to protective heavy work gloves. This masters thesis won the Institution of Engineering and Technology prize for best scoring thesis project in the cohort.

title: Continuum3D: Better 3D printer spaces
info: Product Development for better 3D printer spaces. A final year group project

title: Harbinger: Competition Rover
info: Imperial College Space Society's first competing robot at the European Rover Challenge.

title: Svarog: Interstellar CubeSat
info: An Imperial College Space Society project aiming to create a mission to send a cubesat beyond the Solar system.

title: SPOC: Distributing DoFs in Prosthetics
info: A short-term project on how to improve accessible articulatable prosthetics

title: OptiArch: Generative Architecture
info: The winning submission to the 'Cities of the Future' Hackathon.

title: LumiRo.cc: Visualising Asteroids
info: A submission to the NASASpaceApps Hackathon which won a Global Nomination

title: Autonamous Naval Signalling
info: The winning submission to the Ocean Infinity Hackathon solving the problem of visual signals needing sailors by applying polarising filters.

title: Axxel: Concussion Detection
info: Product design and prototyping of an accessible tool to aid with the diagnosis of rugby-related concissions.

title: Modular CanSat
info: An early Imperial College Space Society project that developed systems, electronics, and mechanical engineering skills by launching and recovering a coke-can format 'satellite'
